task: Make cereal and coffee for breakfast
privileged_goal: Eggs should be accompanied by crispy bacon
Eggs should be accompanied by toast
Only use traditional full calorie sugars in sweet breakfasts, such as french toast, cereal, pancakes, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait
Only use full fat dairy milk
Add a touch of sweetness to non-savory breakfasts such as pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, etc.
Sweet breakfasts like french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes should be topped with maple syrup or honey
Sweet breakfasts french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes topped with nuts
Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred hot
Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred with milk and sugar
Melted cheese is a favorite addition to savory breakfast dishes, such as eggs
A sprinkle of chopped parsley or chives would be a nice touch to eggs
Serving beverages first would be a good approach, so it is ready to be had as soon as possible
Use butter to cook eggs and top toast
Prepare one of sausage, hash browns, or toast as a side when making eggs
Prefer to have a condiment as a side with savory breakfasts
Do not put vegetables in savory breakfasts

rollout.progress_summary: You have not made anything yet.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet

- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.

- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

rollout.privileged_info: Remember, Jamal's preferences include: Only use traditional full calorie sugars in sweet breakfasts, such as french toast, cereal, pancakes, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, Only use full fat dairy milk, Add a touch of sweetness to non-savory breakfasts such as pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, etc., Sweet breakfasts like french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes should be topped with maple syrup or honey, Sweet breakfasts french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes topped with nuts, Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred hot, Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred with milk and sugar, Serving beverages first would be a good approach, so it is ready to be had as soon as possible.
rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.privileged_info: Remember, Jamal's preferences include: Only use traditional full calorie sugars in sweet breakfasts, such as french toast, cereal, pancakes, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, Only use full fat dairy milk, Add a touch of sweetness to non-savory breakfasts such as pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, etc., Sweet breakfasts like french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes should be topped with maple syrup or honey, Sweet breakfasts french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes topped with nuts, Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred hot, Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred with milk and sugar, Serving beverages first would be a good approach, so it is ready to be had as soon as possible.
rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]
